front.title: TLS 1.3 Option for Negotiation of Visibility in the Datacenter

abstract.t: Current drafts of TLS 1.3 do not include the use of the RSA handshake. While (EC) Diffie-Hellman is in nearly all ways an improvement over the TLS RSA handshake, the use of (EC)DH has impacts certain enterprise network operational requirements. The TLS Visibility Extension addresses one of the impacts of (EC)DH through an opt-in mechanism that allows a TLS client and server to explicitly grant access to the TLS session plaintext.
